narrators.alternative_names: Abu Uthman al-Madani, Marwan ibn Uthman

narrators.name: Abdul Malik ibn Abi Najih
narrators.full_name: Abdul Malik ibn Abi Najih Sulayman al-Makki
reliabilityIssues: Category 3 mudallis per Ibn Hajar classification
narrators.alternative_names: Shafi ibn Mati, Ibn Abi Najih al-Makki

narrators.name: Mujahid
narrators.full_name: Mujahid ibn Jabr al-Makki

chainIssues: Ibrahim ibn Fahd (second narrator) has unknown reliability status (majhul)
Abdul Malik ibn Abi Najih is a Category 3 mudallis using 'an transmission - but generally reliable
Transmission changes from direct terms to indirect terms
This is mawquf (stopped at tabi'i Mujahid) - exegetical interpretation, not marfu' to the Prophet ﷺ

potential_issues.issue: Ibrahim ibn Fahd al-Sajji is majhul (unknown reliability)
potential_issues.impact: Weakens chain due to unverified narrator status

potential_issues.issue: Abdul Malik ibn Abi Najih is a Category 3 mudallis with 'an transmission
potential_issues.impact: Mudallis nature noted, but generally accepted as reliable by majority scholars

potential_issues.issue: Muhammad ibn al-Husayn al-Shibaani has unclear early authority
potential_issues.impact: First narrator's reliability affects overall assessment

potential_issues.issue: Mawquf athar - Quranic exegetical interpretation
potential_issues.impact: Authority rests on Mujahid's scholarly credibility and transmission chain reliability

Topics: Quranic exegesis of Surah al-A'raf verse 100
Succession and inheritance of territories
Divine signs in the rise and fall of nations

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated from Mujahid regarding Surah al-A'raf verse 101 and Surah al-An'am verse 28: Signs and verses of Allah.
